pros: This exercise ball has a 6-sided pattern for easy alignment
It's also filled with a weighting material, making it easier to balance
Comes in 45 cm and 65 cm sizes and 2 different colors
cons: The pump is low quality and difficult to use
Some customers noted that the surface is oily

customer_reviews.title: Believe the bad reviews!!
customer_reviews.text: The ball itself is fantastic. It came with the oily film others described, which was easily handled with soap and water. It just boggles the mind that they would have such a horrible inflation system!? My pump came with a torn hose. (see pic) Fortunately I also ordered a $12 ball from another manufacture recently. I used THAT pump to inflate my expensive BOSA ball!? The ball itself is really fantastic. I haven’t found anything else like it on the market. But if you don’t have a way to pump it up, other than the horrific pump they provide, don’t buy!
customer_reviews.author: KB

customer_reviews.title: Yikes!! Absolutely stupid air inflation design😬🤦🏽‍♂️
customer_reviews.text: Inflation Engineering - F grade Ball quality - A grade (The 45cm has a slightly different inner air valve compared to the 65cm). The 45cm ball comes with a cheap ass air pump and the inflation hole is way too large! As soon as you inflate the ball and take out the pump the air rushes out so fast causing the ball to deflate...SO FRUSTRATING🙄😡 Unfortunately I have to return the item... It’s too bad, I was planning on buying 75 balls for my fitness company. If anyone knows how to get a firm ball inflation please let me know.
customer_reviews.author: Rainstorm

customer_reviews.title: Nice Exercise Tool
customer_reviews.text: I attend a class that uses ballast balls for exercise and wanted one to use at home. My instructor suggested the Bosu ball because of the sand that keeps the ball from rolling away when you stand up. I took the ball with me to class one day and used it and it worked just great. It also comes with a foot pump for filling, although I had to have my husband help, not a one person job, for me anyway. An exercise CD is included although I have not used it but plan on in the near future.
customer_reviews.author: Eire

customer_reviews.title: Pain to assemble.
customer_reviews.text: Inflation is a massive pain, the included pump parts don't match those listed in the manual. There's a massive hole rather than a valve. By time I got it pumped up I no longer needed to exercise. Upon removing from box the hole was not plugged and the kitty litter inside the ball spilled everywhere. Also the ball has surface deformations from sitting in the box, hopefully they will go away with time. Lastly its covered in oily nastiness which picked up all the particulates on my floor and made the inflation process even more fun.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Oily residue must be washed off before use
customer_reviews.text: The ball is great, however, it comes coated on the outside with a very disgusting oily substance. I had to wash it in the bathtub several times with Dawn detergent just so I could use it without the oil coming off on my pants! Otherwise, it's a great ball and I'm using it as my chair at my desk. Takes a bit of time to blow up because the pump it comes with is a cheap peace of junk but it does work.
customer_reviews.author: Anona Mouse

customer_reviews.title: greasy residue on ball
customer_reviews.text: The ball came with greasy crap all over it. I could barely fill it up, then had this nasty oily residue all over my hands. It was totally disgusting. I don't know if this vendor is a fake, or if BOSU has awful QC as this thing was gross and unusable. I big disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: Stewart Delnevo

customer_reviews.title: Very unhappy
customer_reviews.text: Poorly designed. Do not purchase. They ship and sale poorly designed, constructed, and incomplete items. Its very unfortunate that the description dkesnt match what was received. I received a pink deflated item, a yello hand bulb pump no line to pump the air into the ball, if that is what i have on hand.
customer_reviews.author: Amber Brashier

customer_reviews.title: IMPOSSIBLE to inflate fully
customer_reviews.text: After receiving my first Ballast ball, I contacted the company directly. I could NOT get the ball to inflate fully. The hole where you connect the pump hose to is so large, that the air immediately escaped when I tried to put the plug in. Bosu sent me a replacement ball, but I had the exact same problem. It is a terrible design and IMPOSSIBLE to inflate fully.
customer_reviews.author: Runner Girl

customer_reviews.title: The ball is okay. The pump is an exercise in failure
customer_reviews.text: I use the ball to sit on at my desk and it's perfect. The only complaint is the pump that comes with it. Whoever designed it obviously didn't use it and it's a pain in the abs to get it right. Also, max inflation can't be reached with the pump. I'd recommend this product if you have an electric pump, or if you would like to boost your patience and wisdom while figuring out how to use the included pump. Update: The AIRHEAD AHP-120 Air Pump 120 volt easily inflated the ball in seconds.
customer_reviews.author: 360spartan

customer_reviews.title: Looses air. Pellets not as shown - they stick ...
customer_reviews.text: Looses air. Pellets not as shown - they stick to the walls. Have older model with no problem. Contacted factory - they sent replacement. Had the same issue, but ball was physically smaller. Will not purchase again. Big frowny face.
customer_reviews.author: KA

customer_reviews.title: Ball can’t be inflated. Disappointed buy
customer_reviews.text: The ball couldn’t be inflated after many attempts following my reading the instruction manual and research online.
customer_reviews.author: Sam Choy Lin

customer_reviews.title: could not blow this up!
customer_reviews.text: I could not blow this up to save my life. Had to return
customer_reviews.author: Christel d.

customer_reviews.title: Works as promissed.
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for my trainer. It's a pain to inflate (I used a compressor) then get the plug in without losing air. It does work great. The four stars would be five if it came with a one way valve to inflate. Makes a great "rain stick" when doing Russian twists.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: The WORST inflation device!
customer_reviews.text: Well I can't say if I like the BBB because I have been working on getting it inflated for 3 days and it is still flat! The gizmo they send to inflate this thing is a mess. Nothing stays together while you are pumping the ball up and the instructions in the book do not match the device they send. A real bummer. I'll let you know how I like it if I can get it inflated this year.
customer_reviews.author: Rina A. Stein

customer_reviews.title: Guarded recommendation
customer_reviews.text: Very hard to inflate. Ineffective pump. Also the ball was covered in a layer of slimy grease when it arrived. But the ball itself is a good addition to any home exercise routine.
customer_reviews.author: Booklover

customer_reviews.title: Only 45cm. I was not sent a 65cm ball ...
customer_reviews.text: Only 45cm. I was not sent a 65cm ball as pictured. The only reason for the two stars is because the ball is well made. However for $50+ I should have received what I ordered a 65cm ball. :(
customer_reviews.author: Casi

customer_reviews.title: Best Ball ever!
customer_reviews.text: This ball is sooo strong and thick! I do not think my kids are going to be able to pop it!! I have had multiple stability balls and this is far and away the best one I have ever owned, highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Tabitha Mattison

customer_reviews.title: Cannot fill with air
customer_reviews.text: The air plug opening is oversized and there is no one-way valve. There is no way to fill with air.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Phillips

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as older model
customer_reviews.text: I found inflating the ball to 65cm to be impossible with the enclosed pump. The nozzle is too small so air would leak around it while inflating the ball. I took it to my trainer and she was able to inflate it with an air compressor. She has an older model that is grey and made of a thicker plastic. She is concerned that mine is a step down in quality and wonders if it will hold up over time. I don't like the transparent plastic as well either.
customer_reviews.author: born2read

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: Good product. My wife has been having fun using it!
customer_reviews.author: Tim M.

customer_reviews.title: EXCELLENT!!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent!!! I've tried many exercise balls this one is by far the best! Very durable and holds air well! Works perfect combined with my Bosu Ball. I would say I am an intermediate when it comes to home equipment, building my equipment and this ball was worth the price!
customer_reviews.author: YoHay

customer_reviews.title: Well Worth It
customer_reviews.text: I like the quality of the product. It is stable; you don't have to worry about is rolling around. I get a very good workout from this ball. This is the second balance ball that I have owned, the first one was a hassle to inflate. The bosu ball uses a foot pump and you can plug it up without losing all that precious air that you just pumped into it. My only complaint is that I wish there were more dvds with different exercise routines specifically designed for the Bosu Ball. That's the reason for 4 stars rather than 5.
customer_reviews.author: MsDandy

customer_reviews.title: Love it an use it daily.
customer_reviews.text: I set at a desk for hours and sitting and balancing on this ball is a perfect exercise regiment. Thanks great product.
customer_reviews.author: Wino of the North Bay

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy.
customer_reviews.text: The color rubs off. Florescent green is allover my clothes. I hope it comes out. It also took 2 months to arrive.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren Yamashita

customer_reviews.title: This ball was impossible to blow up to its full ...
customer_reviews.text: This ball was impossible to blow up to its full capacity. Two people, besides myself, tried. The opening into the ball is too large and allows the air to rush out when you remove the pump. For this price, there should have been a valve of some sort. I ordered two of these and am quite unhappy. I would return them but I've thrown out the packaging.
customer_reviews.author: Judy

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good but not great.
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this ball at my computer desk since February. The product is everything the maker claims it to be, but the air leaks out at a rate whereby I have to add more every week. That can get pretty annoying and the pump is so flimsy I doubt that it (the pump) will last much longer.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Maybe

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t hold air
customer_reviews.text: This ball does not hold the air. We constantly have to refill it - 2-3 times per week. I paid a lot for this ball and am very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Shuggie

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Workout
customer_reviews.text: This ball is incredible. The weighted sand can add so many layers to your workout. The plastic is super thick so it doesn't feel flimsy. Just have to be careful when blowing it up that the sand doesn't fall out.
customer_reviews.author: Looky-Loo

customer_reviews.title: Great ball
customer_reviews.text: I had some back pain and my physiotherapist suggested sitting on a ball while at work. The gym I go to has this ball and I use it all the time for ab work so I decided to buy it. I sit on it at my desk while working for about 30 minutes to an hour at a time. It works great and love using it.
customer_reviews.author: gg

customer_reviews.title: Looks simple, but what a workout
customer_reviews.text: This ball looks so simple but what a workout! My favorite has to be the many version of crunches, doing it on the Bosu Ballast Ball has saved wear and tear on my back while still getting a great workout. I would recommend this for anyone from those of you just starting out to those of you just looking for a different workout. Almost forgot my second favorite workout is doing squats, it personally helps me go a little deeper in the squat since I like to cheat.
customer_reviews.author: Krispini10

customer_reviews.title: Love it! The best thing ever for core
customer_reviews.text: Love it! The best thing ever for core! Will probably purchase one for myself. I took this one to use at the gym for everyone!
customer_reviews.author: Patricia D Dunbar

customer_reviews.title: Great Tool!
customer_reviews.text: I tried this ball at a fitness conference last year and loved it. Now I have several in my personal training studio and have ordered many for my clients home use. There are endless amounts of exercises and a wide range of difficulty. My youngest client (10)loves doing squats to the ball and my senior clients use this ball to increase balance and core development. Love it Love it Love it!!! Peggy Mincey Fit By Design Bonsall, CA
customer_reviews.author: Peggy Mincey

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Tried several different pumps to try and fill these balls up to their full capacity. Bosu, please help
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: We needed a ballast ball for home use. This one met our requirements. I can now do at home what I've been doing with the ballast ball at the gym.
customer_reviews.author: Bev

customer_reviews.title: BOSU
customer_reviews.text: This bosu ball is IMPPOSIBLE to blow, the pump that was sent with it floats in the opening allowing all the air to go back out. Though it looks like the ones at my club, this one has ripples and markings on the inside of the plastic. I intend to file a request to exchange this BOSU from Amazon.com I had a friend fill it with a special "bosu friendly" pump and as of today 9/11 the bosu has worked wonderfully and I want to retract my prior comment.
customer_reviews.author: Rut

customer_reviews.title: Smaller than expected
customer_reviews.text: I bought this ball based on one my trainer has. It's substantially smaller than others. I'm only 5'7 and can't do some of my workouts with this ball. I would say it's of a medium-large size. It's a great ball but just not what I was expecting.
customer_reviews.author: Charlotte B.Top Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: Bought this ball for my boss for work and it is amazing! We have had it for almost a year now and have not had to pump it up once, it has kept its air the whole time.
customer_reviews.author: S. Ruiz-Schluger

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product, especially good for working with individuals with disabilities.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I love the ball
customer_reviews.text: The Bosu Ballast Ball has been around for quite a while. Costs have risen and quality has dropped. I love the ball; but the manufacturing of the ball - as delivered - is far below the quality of the original, more than 10 years ago? Ballast sticks to the sides. Surface of ball layer is thinner. Seams and crevices of the ball WILL NOT BLOW out (unlike the originals - for which I have two) even with use of an electric pump. My students and I are not particularly happy with the "update."
customer_reviews.author: G. Jackson

customer_reviews.title: The ball functions very well but my problem is that ...
customer_reviews.text: The ball functions very well but my problem is that the rubber is thicker in spots and thinner in others. It's very noticeable.
customer_reviews.author: Rose Wernecke

customer_reviews.title: This ball will not hold air and has to be ...
customer_reviews.text: This ball will not hold air and has to be pumped up every day. I would not purchase this ball again!!!
customer_reviews.author: Dewey Ryan

customer_reviews.title: size is wrong
customer_reviews.text: size is not 65cm,just 45cm.it s a kid s toy.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy Wong

customer_reviews.title: Good if you are very unstable or very advanced.
customer_reviews.text: i'm a pilates teacher and this product was great for people that are so unstable that they can't sit on a regular ball without falling over (I have seen very few people are this weak). This is also great for advanced students that are strong enough to do push-ups on it etc (i see very few students that are this strong). It's not very useful for anyone in between-which is most of my students. it does do what it says though.
customer_reviews.author: Pilates Person

customer_reviews.title: My co-worker has this same brand and style of ball but it's much larger and it's perfect to sit on while working at your desk
customer_reviews.text: Be careful to read the dimensions. The measurements are in centimeters not inches. My co-worker has this same brand and style of ball but it's much larger and it's perfect to sit on while working at your desk. I thought I was ordering the same size but realized it was much smaller once I started blowing it up. Unfortunately, it wasn't worth the shipping cost to return.
customer_reviews.author: Jobemom

customer_reviews.title: Serious flaw in design
customer_reviews.text: A great idea of a product. However, the three friends and I that purchased them all found the same problem-- it loses air really quickly. So, use it once and it is much deflated within an hour. My other exercise balls stay pumped up for weeks. I will be giving this item away. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Martha Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Love this ball
customer_reviews.text: These balls are great! There are so many different exercises that you can do with them and since they have media inside they are more stabile then a regular stability ball. I totally recommend this ball to any exerciser or fitness professional!!! A must have!!!
customer_reviews.author: Alicia Adamson

customer_reviews.title: Defective pump
customer_reviews.text: This product came with the wrong pump it doesn’t fit in the hole to blow it up which defeats the purpose of a stability ball. Also tried an electric pump and it still would only go to this point in the picture. Will not order again overpriced and not useable.
customer_reviews.author: Lee Boatright

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected
customer_reviews.text: Covered in slimy goo and not a great size - seems too small to really be usable. Not loving it at all.
customer_reviews.author: Jermo

customer_reviews.title: Ballast ball
customer_reviews.text: One of the balls came with a Vaseline top film on it. I have never ordered used items before so I guess you get what you pay for Not sure I will do this again
customer_reviews.author: beth j.

customer_reviews.title: Really like this ball for the price and quality
customer_reviews.text: the ball was a bit smaller than we thought it would be, but all in all its a great ball and we're happy with the purchase I should have checked the sizes before buying it or measured my old ball.
customer_reviews.author: Arielle N. Leduc

customer_reviews.title: Accompanying DVD is defective
customer_reviews.text: The only problem is that the accompanying DVD is defective. This is the best ball, because of the ballast, which provides stability
customer_reviews.author: inge

customer_reviews.title: Smaller that expected
customer_reviews.text: The balls that I purchased were much smaller that I expected. Its not 65 mm for sure. Very disappointed!!
customer_reviews.author: Lauren Urcuyo

customer_reviews.title: Thinking about returning this item!!
customer_reviews.text: The circumference is smaller than expected and the pump to blow it up is worthless! I am seriously thinking of returning this item!
customer_reviews.author: Tammy L Gilder

customer_reviews.title: Bosu Ball a Bomb
customer_reviews.text: I bought this ball back in June 2009 and just got around to trying to use it. The ball is very difficult to inflate with the foot pump and instructions provided. I never got it to inflate properly. By the time I realized it was garbage, it was too late to return to Amazon for a refund. I gave it away to Goodwill.
customer_reviews.author: Aya

product_meta.title: BOSU Ballast Exercise Ball
product_meta.description: Introducing the new Bosu ballast ball 45cm. The new, smaller size is Great for all ages. Constructed of high quality, burst-resistant material, it has a six-sided surface design for proper alignment and positioning and has 2.5 lbs. Of multi-dimensional load, which provides a fun, visual effect and audible feedback during lifting, shifting, and shaking exercises. Proudly made in the USA . Phthalate and latex free. Includes Bosu ballast ball, foot pump, and owners manual.
feature_bullets: BOSU Ballast Ball has 2.5 pounds of movable weight inside that engages and targets more core and stabilizer muscles during exercises and creates more intense and efficient workouts. Overall ball weight is approximately 5 pounds.

The 45cm BOSU Ballast Ball is identical to the 65 cm but smaller in size and is ideal for smaller spaces, smaller adults or adults that want a slightly smaller ball weight. Maximum user weight is 250 pounds for the 45 cm ball.

Constructed of thick, high-quality, burst-resistant material that features a six-sided surface design for proper alignment and positioning to get the most out of each workout. Weight inside keeps the ball from rolling during workouts for added safety.
Package includes BOSU Ballast Ball, pump, measuring tape, owner’s manual and workout DVD. The included DVD shows effective and unique ways to use the Ballast Ball. Proudly made in the USA.
Package includes BOSU Ballast Ball, pump, measuring tape, and owner’s manual. Proudly made in the USA.
